info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 11:58PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calhoun, Van Buren, Allegan, Kent, Ottawa, Ionia, Barry, Muskegon, Kalamazoo, Eaton and Montcalm Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1157 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles southeast of Port Washington to 22 miles west of Holland SP to near Vicksburg. Movement was east at 30 mph. Additional storms are expected to move through the area overnight. Some of these storms will have the potential to become severe with large hail and wind gusts to 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grand Rapids... Lansing... Kalamazoo... Portage... Muskegon... Holland... Ionia... Grand Haven... Charlotte... Albion... Greenville... Hastings... Marshall... Battle Creek... Eaton Rapids... Allegan... South Haven... Portland... Paw Paw... Stanton... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
